body_html:
@hartsantler You do not need to build Bazel from source. As @chenghuige mentioned, you can use the latest Bazel binary installer instead: http://bazel.io/docs/install.html. Have you given that a try?

I had thought the TensorFlow docs were updated to instruct to use the Bazel 0.1.1 installer since #130 was closed, but it looks like the docs haven't been updated yet.

We definitely want to make it easy to both install and build Bazel on every platform and will work on fixing the issues you reported in bazelbuild/bazel#640 for building Bazel on Fedora.
